wsoauth-desc: Extends the PluggableAuth extension to provide authentication using OAuth.
wsoauth-auth-providers-desc: An array containing a list of custom OAuth providers together with their class name.
wsoauth-auto-populate-groups-desc: An array containing a list of MediaWiki group names that must be automatically assigned to the user after they are authenticated.
wsoauth-authentication-failure: Authentication failed (are you authorised for this wiki?).
wsoauth-invalid-username: Username provided by the OAuth provider is not valid.
wsoauth-unknown-auth-provider-class-exce: OAuth provider class not loaded or not found
wsoauth-invalid-auth-provider-class-exce: The OAuth provider class does not implement AuthProvider
wsoauth-initiate-login-failure: Unable to initiate communication with OAuth provider.
wsoauth-migrate-users-by-username-desc: Whether or not to allow usurpation of existing accounts by username (used only if migrateUsersByUsername is not set for the specific authentication provider).
wsoauth-not-configured-message: Remote login has not been configured for this wiki. Please try a different authentication method.
wsoauth-disallow-remote-only-accounts-de: Whether or not to allow accounts to not have a local counterpart (used only if disallowRemoteOnlyAccounts is not set for the specific authentication provider).
wsoauth-already-logged-in-through-remote: You are already logged in through a remote or migrated account. You cannot connect a remote account to this account. If you want to log in using another remote, please log out and log in using the other account.
wsoauth-remote-only-accounts-disabled: Remote-only login has been disabled on this wiki. A remote account must be connected to a local account.
wsoauth-special-page-content: You can connect a remote account to this account by logging in to the remote from [[Special:UserLogin]] while being logged in. In the future, it will be possible to manage your remote accounts from this special page.
wsoauth-use-real-name-as-username-desc: Whether to use the real name as the username (used only if useRealNameAsUsername is not set for the specific authentication provider).
